tournament.name: Grand Open Qualifier  - Legacy European Tour

decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay and utilizing the Cascade mechanic. It includes creatures like Brazen Borrower and Shardless Agent to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent. Spells like Dead / Gone and Fire / Ice provide removal and additional flexibility. Force of Negation and Mystical Dispute offer counter magic options. Violent Outburst and Crashing Footfalls provide powerful Cascade effects to generate additional threats on the battlefield. The inclusion of Lórien Revealed and Brotherhood's End shows the deck's emphasis on deck manipulation. The land base includes various fetch lands and triomes for color-fixing and consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and enable explosive plays. The deck focuses on ramping up its resources quickly through cards like Arboreal Grazer, Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, and Primeval Titan. It also utilizes Urza's Saga to search for important pieces and The One Ring to create additional tokens. The deck also includes land cards that provide additional utility, such as Boseiju, Who Endures for protection and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle for burn damage. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with big plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cycling creatures and cascade spells to achieve a powerful combo play called "Living End." The key concept is to cycle through creatures with high mana costs, such as Architects of Will and Curator of Mysteries, and utilize cascade spells like Violent Outburst to cast Living End, which then brings all creatures from both players' graveyards into play. This combo can quickly overwhelm opponents and create a favorable board state. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to control the game and protect its combo.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early on with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters. It also disrupts the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thoughtseize and Dauthi Voidwalker to gain information and remove key cards from their hand. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to deal with threats, and utilizes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Grief to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's resources. Additionally, the deck has access to disruptive lands like Blood Moon and Castle Locthwain to further hinder the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on using a combination of creatures and spells to create a powerful toolbox effect. It utilizes creatures like Delighted Halfling, Ignoble Hierarch, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Grist, the Hunger Tide to generate multiple advantages. It also includes cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron, Chord of Calling, and Eldritch Evolution to search for and play specific creatures when needed. The deck aims to control the board and gain value through sacrifice effects with cards like Blood Artist and Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons. The mana base is designed to provide various colors of mana efficiently.

This deck focuses on the concept of using cycling creatures and cascade spells to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures. The key strategy revolves around casting Living End to bring all creatures from the graveyard onto the battlefield at once, effectively resetting the board and overwhelming the opponent. The deck includes many cycling creatures like Architects of Will and Curator of Mysteries, as well as cascade spells like Violent Outburst. It also utilizes force of negation to protect its combo and can benefit from the land Boseiju, Who Endures to ensure successful spell resolution.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Cascade mechanic to cast Living End, which allows the player to exile all creatures from both players' graveyards and put all creature cards from their own graveyard onto the battlefield. By cycling through their deck with cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries, the player can set up a board state advantage by casting Living End and overwhelming their opponent with a sudden influx of creatures. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly apply aggressive pressure on the opponent using low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Murktide Regent. These creatures are supported by efficient removal spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt to clear the opponent's threats. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and filtering effects through Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to maintain a consistent flow of threats and answers. Finally, the inclusion of Blood Moon acts as a disruptive element against certain strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures with high power and evasion, such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Wild Nacatl, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of 3 Nishoba Brawlers and Orcish Bowmasters adds additional combat strength. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board. The deck's mana base is built to support playing creatures of different colors, maximizing the potential damage output with spells like Tribal Flames.

The key concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive gameplay style, utilizing creatures that have high power and toughness ratios for their mana cost. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while also including efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The inclusion of Nishoba Brawler and Scion of Draco adds additional power to the deck, making it even more difficult for opponents to defend against. The deck also utilizes a variety of land types to enable the use of Tribal Flames and maximize its effectiveness.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Cascade mechanic through cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst. By casting spells with Cascade, the deck can put additional cards onto the battlefield for free, creating a potentially overwhelming board presence. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Mystical Dispute to control the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck features a mix of removal spells and versatile creatures to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. Overall, the deck relies on efficient and explosive aggression to quickly overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing cascade mechanics and aggressive play to overwhelm opponents. It aims to generate value and tempo by cascading into high-impact spells like Crashing Footfalls and Lórien Revealed. The deck also includes a mix of disruptive elements such as Force of Negation and Mystical Dispute to disrupt opponents' game plans. The mana base is designed to support the deck's colors and includes utility lands like Otawara, Soaring City and Boseiju, Who Endures. With a mix of efficient creatures, powerful cascade spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, and Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana. This allows the player to play powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes cards like Oblivion Stone and Dismember to remove the opponent's threats, and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies. Additionally, Karn, the Great Creator is included to tutor specific artifacts from the sideboard, further enhancing the control aspect of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combination of Amulet of Vigor, Urza's Saga, and Primeval Titan to generate a powerful board presence and generate immense value. By using Amulet of Vigor, the deck is able to untap lands when they enter the battlefield, allowing for explosive mana generation and potentially casting multiple spells in a turn. Urza's Saga provides a valuable tutor effect, allowing the deck to find important pieces such as The One Ring or Summoner's Pact. Primeval Titan acts as a win condition, fetching important lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle or The Mycosynth Gardens, while also providing a powerful body on the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to manipulate lands, generate mana, and overwhelm the opponent with massive threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay and utilizing the Cascade mechanic to its advantage. The key concept is to constantly cascade into powerful spells such as Crashing Footfalls and Lórien Revealed, which provide a constant stream of creatures to overpower the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Subtlety and Tishana's Tidebinder to control the opponent's board. Additionally, it features a mix of versatile spells like Fire / Ice and Dead / Gone to handle various situations. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent and efficient casting of its spells.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of creature cards as a toolbox for various strategies. It aims to assemble specific creatures, such as Orcish Bowmasters and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, in order to generate powerful synergistic effects and disrupt the opponent's board state. The deck also includes a mix of utility creatures like Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons and Strangleroot Geist to provide additional options and flexibility. With the help of Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution, the deck can efficiently search for and deploy the necessary creatures.

The key concept of this deck is to create a combo by pairing Saheeli Rai with Felidar Guardian, allowing the player to copy the creature token that enters the battlefield and continuously create additional tokens. This combo can be further enhanced by using Wrenn and Six to recur lands and provide additional value, and by using Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate mana and increase the power of the combo. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Solitude, Prismatic Ending, and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and protect the combo.

The key concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a synergistic combination of low-cost Merfolk creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Silvergill Adept, Merfolk Trickster, and Master of the Pearl Trident, the deck aims to establish an early board presence and apply constant pressure. Additionally, cards like Tide Shaper, Subtlety, and Tishana's Tidebinder further disrupt the opponent's game plan while Lord of Atlantis buffs the team. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Negation and Dismember to handle threats and maintain tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans and limiting their options. It utilizes cards like Force of Negation, Counterspell, and Leyline Binding to counter or prevent the opponent's plays. Day's Undoing allows for card advantage while keeping the opponent's hand empty. Prismatic Ending and Supreme Verdict provide board control and removal options. The deck also includes Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to further disrupt the opponent's strategies. The ultimate goal is to secure victory through the use of The One Ring while maintaining control of the game.

The key concept of the deck revolves around utilizing control elements to gain advantage and ultimately win the game. The deck includes various control cards such as counterspells, removal spells, and card-draw spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game. The centerpiece of the deck is "The One Ring," which provides additional resources and powers up the spells. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of creatures that can provide additional control options or serve as threats to pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The deck's main concept revolves around utilizing mill cards and control elements to quickly and efficiently deplete the opponent's library. This is achieved through the use of cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Archive Trap, and Fractured Sanity to mill the opponent's cards. The deck also includes control elements such as Drown in the Loch, Fatal Push, and Surgical Extraction to manage the opponent's threats and disrupt their strategy. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and library manipulation tools like Visions of Beyond, Jace, the Perfected Mind, and Shelldock Isle to maintain card advantage and find key pieces.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana early in the game. This allows the player to cast powerful and expensive spells such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Karn, the Great Creator to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra source of mana and flexibility to the deck's overall game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of powerful creatures (Tishana's Tidebinder, Delighted Halfling, Omnath, Locus of Creation) and control spells (Solitude, Supreme Verdict, Prismatic Ending) to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The One Ring serves as a win condition, providing an advantage over time. Leyline Binding helps to lock down the opponent's resources. Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six provide additional control and card advantage. The deck also utilizes a diverse land base to ensure access to all colors of mana.

This deck is focused on aggressive play, aiming to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes a diverse range of creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Wild Nacatl, Nishoba Brawler, Orcish Bowmasters, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco. The deck also includes removal and disruption spells like Lightning Bolt, Stubborn Denial, Dromoka's Command, and Tribal Flames. The mana base is designed to support a 4/5-color strategy, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient aggro strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by using aggressive creatures and direct burn spells. The deck aims to pressure the opponent and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize or gain control of the game. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to start attacking early, accompanied by a suite of burn spells such as Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Skewer the Critics to deal direct damage. The deck also includes cards like Searing Blaze and Roiling Vortex to control the opponent's board and prevent them from gaining life. The mana base is constructed to provide consistent access to red mana for casting spells efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Cascade mechanic as a means of quickly and efficiently deploying threats onto the battlefield. Cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst allow the player to cascade into spells like Crashing Footfalls, which creates a board presence of 4/4 trampling Rhino tokens. This deck also includes powerful cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Teferi, Time Raveler to further enhance its aggressive strategy. Leyline Binding helps to control the opponent's spells, while the land base allows for flexibility in casting various spells.

This deck focuses on using Indomitable Creativity as its primary combo piece. It aims to leverage Leyline Binding and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to generate a large number of tokens, which can then be converted into powerful creatures through the use of Indomitable Creativity. The deck also includes various disruptive elements such as Spell Pierce and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and protect its combo. The mana base is designed to provide flexibility and consistency through fetch lands and a mix of different dual lands.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to dominate the game by controlling the opponent's actions and resources. It achieves this through a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw. This allows the deck to maintain control of the board state and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck has a strong late-game presence with powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Shark Typhoon. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and flexibility in the deck's options. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outplay the opponent through careful manipulation of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly equip Colossus Hammer onto a creature, utilizing the Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic to search for and cheat out the equipment. The deck aims to assemble a powerful creature quickly, using efficient artifacts like Ornithopter and Gingerbrute, and protect it with cards like Giver of Runes and Esper Sentinel. The deck also incorporates the land Urza's Saga to generate additional artifacts and provide card advantage. Additional support is provided through cards like Solitude, Springleaf Drum, and Surge of Salvation.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between +1/+1 counters and artifacts to create a powerful aggressive strategy. The deck includes cards like Arcbound Ravager, Hangarback Walker, and Walking Ballista to generate and distribute +1/+1 counters. Hardened Scales and Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp further enhance this strategy. The deck also includes support cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron, The Ozolith, and Welding Jar to protect and optimize the counters. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to provide additional value and resilience.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and graveyard manipulation. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Dauthi Voidwalker, while also removing threats with cards such as Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict. The deck also incorporates a strong mana base with Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Cabal Coffers to generate additional resources. The deck's win condition is to outlast the opponent through attrition and ultimately overpower them with the powerful creatures and planeswalkers it contains.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and land destruction. The deck utilizes cards like Fatal Push, Damnation, and Bloodchief's Thirst to remove the opponent's threats, while Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize are used to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also employs land destruction with cards like Field of Ruin and Demolition Field to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and outlast the opponent using its powerful spells and card advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board with a mix of faeries and wizards. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and disruptive creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Snapcaster Mage. It also has a strong burn package with Lightning Bolt and Wizard's Lightning to finish off opponents or clear the way for attacks. The deck utilizes key lands like Mutavault and Otawara, Soaring City to further support its aggro strategy while maintaining tempo and card advantage.

This deck focuses on control and using "The One Ring" as a key card. It aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Counterspell, Supreme Verdict, and Leyline Binding to hinder the opponent's strategy. It also includes cards like Chalice of the Void and Prismatic Ending for versatile removal options. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes some creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Solitude for board presence and removal. Overall, the deck aims to establish control and utilize "The One Ring" to further manipulate and dominate the game.

The key concept of this UR Control deck is to maintain control of the game by countering opponent's spells and removing threats using cards like Counterspell, Archmage's Charm, and Unholy Heat. The deck also relies on card advantage and selection with Preordain, Consider, Mishra's Bauble, and Snapcaster Mage. Lórien Revealed and Flame of Anor provide additional card draw and removal options. The deck includes a small creature package with Tishana's Tidebinder to tap down opposing creatures and provide a win condition. Overall, the deck aims to control the game state and win through attrition.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board while using efficient creatures to deal damage quickly. It aims to utilize the synergy between cheap spells and cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to generate card advantage and maintain board presence. The deck also includes a mix of disruption spells like Counterspell and Lightning Bolt to control the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creature-based strategies and control elements to outpace and disrupt the opponent.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and disruption. It utilizes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to quickly establish a threatening board presence. The deck also incorporates efficient removal spells such as Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt to control the opponent's board. Counterspell, Spell Snare, and Spell Pierce provide additional disruption, while Archmage's Charm and Force of Negation offer versatility and protection. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Preordain ensures card selection and deck manipulation, allowing for optimal plays. The deck's mana base enables consistent casting with lands like Scalding Tarn and Steam Vents.

The focal point of this Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro deck lies in leveraging efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and card advantage to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle. It utilizes powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Murktide Regent, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply continuous pressure on opponents. The deck incorporates a mix of removal options such as Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the board and disruptive spells like Counterspell and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, card selection and advantage are achieved through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Preordain to maintain consistency and tempo.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana. It utilizes control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Karn, the Great Creator to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to quickly close out the game. It uses cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to efficiently search for key pieces of the Tron lands. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.
